concept-wr.title: Ethernet Interfaces
concept-wr.shortdesc: Ethernet interfaces, both physical and virtual, play a key role in the overall performance of the virtualized network. Therefore, it is important to understand the available interface types, their configuration options, and their impact on network design.

conbody.p: On compute node data interfaces, HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade supports Ethernet Network Interface Cards (NIC) based on the following chip sets:
The following virtual network interfaces are available:

section.title: About LAG/AE Interfaces
section.p: To provide link protection, Ethernet interfaces in a LAG group can be attached either to the same L2 switch, or to multiple switches in a redundant configuration. For more information about L2 switch configurations, see . For information about the different LAG modes, see the HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade Software Installation Guide.
